column3:
Everything Uin Nee does, they do for the children.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Search for relics near the House of the First Light.
Deliver the drowned relic to Uin Nee.

Answer me this, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>: when you were a child, what was your favorite dream you ever dreamed? Wait, you <Emphasis>were</Emphasis> a dreaming child once, yes? That's how it works, is it not?

Anyhow, let me guess: you loved to dream of going on grand adventures. Journeying to the bottom of the deepest waters! Braving perilous ruins in search of ancient treasures! Why, that's what <Emphasis>I'd</Emphasis> like to dream of if I were a mortal child!

Yes, I do believe that settles it: something precious from the ruins of the House of the First Light should be just what I need to spin the most stirring and dramatic dream ever! And <Emphasis>you're</Emphasis> going to bring it to me─for the children, of course!

What sort of relic will make the children happy? Well, how should I know? Only one of us has been a mortal child once, and it certainly isn't me! Anyhow, I'll leave it up to you. If I don't like what you bring me, I'll just send you back for more! Tee hee!
Ooh! You're back! Wait...back from where, again? Oh, that's right! Tell me: what wondrous relic did you find for me under the waters?
Why, it's a teensy-weensy figure of a knight. How very interesting!

They say that in the old days of Voeburt, people used to play a game where they moved these bitsy people around a board. It doesn't sound nearly as fun as spinning dreams, but to each their own, I suppose.
A silver ring...? It's so strangely cold to the touch. And these engravings...
Ack! These runes are to ward away pixies! Whatever is the meaning of this, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>!? Could it be that─gasp!─you don't like me as much as I like you?
Why, it's an old Voeburtite coin! They say that back in the days of the Kingdom, you could buy all sorts of things with these. I haven't seen one of these in years...
Anyhow, I simply must polish it up to the finest sheen! Only the very best for my dreamers!

In any event, I do believe this will make for a most rousing treasure hunt for the children. If only you could be a child again, yes? I'd like nothing more than to spin you a dream as a token of my thanks!
